'Joseph Force Crater' (January 5, 1889 â on or after August 6, 1930) was a judge
in New York City who disappeared on the night of August 6, 1930. He was last
seen leaving a restaurant on 45th Street. He had stated earlier that he was
planning to attend a Broadway show. His disappearance became one of the most
famous in American history and pop culture, and earned him the title of "The
Missingest Man in New York".
